2014–2015 (Novorossiya) |rank=[[Sergeant#Russian Federation|Senior sergeant]] (Ukraine)
[[Kombrig]] ([[Novorossiya]]) |unit={{flagicon image|Flag of the Ghost Brigade.svg}} [[Prizrak Brigade]] |battles=[[War in Donbass]] *[[Battle of Debaltseve]] |relations= |laterwork= |signature= }} '''Aleksey Borisovich Mozgovoy''' ({{lang-ru|Алексе́й Бори́сович Мозгово́й}}, {{lang-uk|Олексі́й Бори́сович Мозгови́й}}, ''Oleksiy Borisovich Mozhovyj;'' 3 April 1975 – 23 May 2015) was a [[rebellion|rebel]] commander of the [[self-proclaimed]] [[Luhansk People's Republic]] in [[Ukraine]]. He was the leader of the pro-Russian [[Prizrak Brigade]].{{cite web|author=Allison Quinn |url=http://www.kyivpost.com/content/kyiv-post-plus/russian-backed-military-commander-assassinated-after-speaking-out-against-cease-fire-389345.html |title=Russian-backed military commander assassinated after speaking out against cease-fire |publisher=Kyivpost.com |date=23 May 2015 |accessdate=9 July 2015}} He was assassinated in Donbass, with conflicting reports on who was responsible.{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/ukraine-crisis-who-killed-rebel-leaders-alexei-mozgovoy-alexandr-batman-bednov-1504388|title=Ukraine crisis: Who killed rebel leaders Alexei Mozgovoy and Alexandr 'Batman' Bednov?|author=Orlando Crowcroft|work=International Business Times|date=4 June 2015|accessdate=16 October 2016}} == Biography == Mozgovoy was born in the village of Nizhnyaya Duvanka, [[Svatove Raion]], [[Luhansk Oblast]] located in the eastern part of [[Ukraine]]. Mozgovoy grew up in [[Svatove]] township where he participated in a local choir, the ''Svatove Cossacks''. Just before the [[2014 pro-Russian unrest in Ukraine]], (the "Russian Spring") Mozgovoy was a guest worker, employed as a cook in [[Saint Petersburg]].{{cite news|url=http://espreso.tv/article/2014/05/16/putin_stavyt_na_shapkovykh_atamaniv_na_donbasi|script-title=uk:Путін ставить на шапкових отаманів. Луганщина|trans-title=Putin bets on the "capped" atamans. Luhansk region|language=uk|work=Espreso TV|date=16 May 2014}} In 2014, during conflict in eastern [[Ukraine]], he became commander of the military formation "Prizrak" (''Ghost''). Unofficially, his armed group was known as the ''Antratsyt Cossacks''.{{cite news |url=http://www.dsnews.ua/politics/chomu-terorist-mozgoviy-poshle-na-tri-bukvi-generala-novorosiyi--22092014123100|script-title=uk:Чому терорист Мозговий пошле на три букви «генерала Новоросії» Бєса|trans-title=Why terrorist Mozgovoy tells the "General of Novorossiya" Bes to piss off|language=uk|work=DS News|date=22 September 2014}} Mozgovoy was allied with [[Igor Girkin]], the Donetsk People's Republic minister for defense. He was known for infighting with other [[Luhansk People's Republic]] (LPR) rebels.{{cite news|author=Kirill Mikhailov|author2=Mat Babiak|title=Something is rotten in the Luhansk Republic|url=http://ukrainianpolicy.com/something-is-rotten-in-the-luhansk-republic/|accessdate=25 May 2015|publisher=Ukrainian Policy|date=6 January 2015}} Mozgovoy had contact with the leader of the [[LDPR (political party)|Liberal Democratic Party of Russia]], [[Vladimir Zhirinovsky]], and the leader of [[A Just Russia]], [[Sergei Mironov]].{{cite news|title=Ukraine crisis: Inside pro-Russia militia training camp |url=http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-27447264 |newspaper=BBC |date=19 May 2014 |accessdate=25 May 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141012154552/http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-27447264 |archivedate=12 October 2014 |df= }} ==Death== Mozgovoy was killed in an [[ambush]] which took place between [[Luhansk]] and [[Alchevsk]]. A press secretary, driver, and six bodyguards were also killed.{{cite news|url=http://en.apa.az/xeber_commander_of____ghost____brigade__lpr_army___227483.html|title=Commander of 'Ghost' brigade (LPR Army) Aleksey Mozgovoy was assassinated|date=23 May 2015|publisher=[[Azerbaijan Press Agency|APA]]}}{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-32861947|title=Ukraine crisis: Rebel commander Alexei Mozgovoi 'killed'|date=23 May 2015|publisher=BBC News}} The attack on Mozgovoy's motorcade consisted of a roadside bombing followed by machine gun fire.{{cite news|author=Radina Gigova |url=http://www.cnn.com/2015/05/24/europe/ukraine-separatist-commander-killed/index.html |title=Separatist commander killed in eastern Ukraine |publisher=CNN.com |date=25 May 2015 |accessdate=9 July 2015}} The [[Luhansk People's Republic|LPR]] press service attributed the attack to undefined saboteurs.{{cite news|title=Russian-backed military commander assassinated after speaking out against cease-fire|url=http://www.kyivpost.com/content/kyiv-post-plus/russian-backed-military-commander-assassinated-after-speaking-out-against-cease-fire-389345.html|newspaper=Kyiv Post|date=23 May 2015|accessdate=25 May 2015}} Surviving leaders of the Prizrak Brigade stated that Ukrainian commandos were responsible, and they called on their supporters to not spread false rumors.{{cite web|url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/ukraine/11627349/Ukrainian-separatist-warlord-assassinated-by-land-mine.html|title=Ukrainian separatist warlord assassinated by land-mine|author=Roland Oliphant|work=The Telegraph|date=24 May 2015|accessdate=16 October 2016}} Anton Gerashchenko, the adviser to the Ukrainian [[Ministry of Internal Affairs (Ukraine)|minister for internal affairs]], claimed Mozgovoy was assassinated by Russian [[Spetsnaz GRU|GRU special forces]].{{cite news|title=Avakov's adviser: Mozgovoy eliminated by Russia's GRU special forces|url=http://www.unian.info/war/1081359-avakovs-adviser-mozgovoy-eliminated-by-russias-gru-special-forces.html|date=23 May 2015|accessdate=25 May 2015|agency=UNIAN}}{{Cite web|title = Управление ФСБ по "Русскому миру"|url = http://www.novayagazeta.ru/inquests/67915.html|accessdate = 2015-07-20}} Two months prior to his death, Mozgovoy had survived a similar assassination attempt in the same area. He was said to be dismissive of threats to his life.{{cite web|url=http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/ukraine-crisis-the-last-days-of-aleksey-mozgovoi-rebel-hero-of-the-ghost-battalion-killed-in-an-10273837.html|title=Ukraine crisis: The last days of Aleksey Mozgovoi, rebel hero of the 'Ghost' battalion - killed in an ambush|author=Oliver Carroll|work=The Independent|date=24 May 2015|accessdate=10 September 2015}} Prior to his death, Mozgovoy's Prizrak brigade had been having supply issues due to his refusal to join the formal LPR power structure. It had dwindled from 3,000 fighters to several hundred. Mozgovoy and two of his colleagues, Andrey Kozlov and Anna Samelyuk, decided to move into politics and, with the assistance of the [[Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe]] (OSCE), sent an application to Kiev to register the political party ''Narodnoye vozrozhdeniye'' (National Renewal). It was sent to Kiev instead of to Lugansk as a proper legal process did not yet exist in the LPR for the registration of political parties. The application was received by Ukraine's [[Ministry of Justice (Ukraine)|Ministry of Justice]] on May 5, and accepted by May 8, thus becoming the first and only political party registered by Ukraine that originated in one of the breakaway rebel territories, and the only one that Ukraine would recognize legally according to the [[Minsk II]] peace agreement.Skomorokhov, Roman. {{ru-icon}} [http://topwar.ru/92986-za-chto-ubili-alekseya-mozgovogo-itogi-rassledovaniya.html За что убили Алексея Мозгового. Итоги расследования]. ''Voennoye obozreniye''. Mar. 28, 2016. On May 8, there was an international anti-fascist forum in the city of [[Alchevsk]] in the LPR, which included around 100 attendees, including OSCE members.{{ru-icon}} [http://news-front.info/2015/05/10/v-alchevske-proshel-forum-antifashistov-i-kommunistov-iz-mnogix-stran-mira/ В Алчевск из многих стран мира приехали антифашисты, чтобы участвовать на грандиозном форуме]. ''News-front.info'' May 10, 2015. By the evening, the registration of the new party had become widely known among the attendees. The following day, the LPR authorities denied Mozgovoy permission to stage a [[Victory Day (9 May)|May 9 Victory Day]] parade. Of the three founders of the new party, two (Mozgovoy and Samelyuk) were killed in the May 23 bombing. The third, Andrey Kozlov, was arrested by the LPR authorities the following day. After several months, his friends and family lost contact with him. His current whereabouts and health status are unknown. ==Controversy== In October 2014 he headed a "people's court" that produced a death sentence against a suspect accused of rape by asking the audience to raise hands.{{cite web|url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/ukraine/11201446/Rebels-in-Ukraine-post-video-of-peoples-court-sentencing-man-to-death.html|title=Rebels in Ukraine 'post video of people's court sentencing man to death'| publisher=The Telegraph|date=31 October 2014|accessdate=5 October 2014}}{{cite news|author=Dina Newman|url=http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-29876687|title=Ukraine conflict: Summary justice in rebel east|publisher=BBC|date=3 November 2014|accessdate=9 July 2015}} Answering questions from the audience afterward, Mozgovoy said that he ordered his patrols to "arrest any woman found sitting in a pub or cafe". The statement that caused the controversy was: {{quotation|If tomorrow I see in a cafe, in a pub even one young lady, she will be arrested ... А woman should be the guardian of the hearth, the mother. And what kind of mothers do they become after pubs? ... A woman should stay in the house baking [[pirozhki]] and only celebrate [meaning "drink" in this context] on the [[International Women's Day]]. It is time to remember that you are Russian! It is time to get your spirituality back!}} After the statement caused a significant critical response in Russian media, he had to explain that he said that because he thought that women "should care about their safety", that the intention of the statement was to make people think about morals and that he was not going to arrest anyone.{{cite web|url=http://lenta.ru/news/2014/11/04/trial/|script-title=ru:В Алчевске ополченцы запретили женщинам посещать кафе|trans-title=In Alchevsk insurgents forbade women from sitting in a cafe|language=ru|publisher=Lenta|date=5 November 2014|accessdate=5 November 2014}}{{cite news|url=http://www.gazeta.ru/comments/2014/11/05_e_6289401.shtml|script-title=ru:По морали военного времени|trans-title=By the morals of war time|language=ru|agency=Gazeta.ru|date=5 November 2014|accessdate=5 November 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://informator.lg.ua/?p=45781|script-title=ru:Мозговой отказался от собственных слов и заявил, что девушек арестовывать не будет|trans-title=Mozgovoy renounced his own words and stated that he won't arrest young women|date=6 November 2014|publisher=Informator.lg.ua|language=ru|accessdate=8 November 2014}} ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Aleksey Mozgovoy}} * [https://web.archive.org/web/20141012154106/http://mozgovoy.info/ Official website] * [https://www.stihi.ru/avtor/fktrc1975 Mozgovoy poetry] * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sKwBuCTn0z4 Mozgovoy performs a song "My little daughter" in Ukrainian language] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20141012154350/http://www.novorosinform.org/reference/id/21 Aleksei Mozgovoy] at the Novorossiya Information agency * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q9lI1F59Qhg (eng subs) Militia brigade "Ghost" takes oath to Novorossia 09/09/14] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20141012154552/http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-27447264 Ukraine crisis: Inside pro-Russia militia training camp].
